title: Fuel Filter - Renew

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
A fire, causing personal injury and damage to property could result from spilled fuel or fuel not handled or stored correctly.
Remove fuel pump assembly D34; DD2; DD4; DE2; DEX; DF2; DF4; DG4

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: D34; DD4; DG4; DF4; DEX; DD2; DF2; DE2

body.body: Release the two fuel hose clips from either side of the fuel filter.
Remove the hose bracket from the fuel pump bracket.

body.name: Remove hose bracket from pump bracket civv

body.body: Carefully detach the baffle housing from the fuel pump.
Remove the fuel pump securing bolt and strap.
Disconnect the fuel pump hose from the fuel filter inlet.
Remove and discard the two fuel filter cable ties.

body.name: cable ties on fuel pump civv_1

body.body: Prior to removing the filter, note the direction of the arrow on the side of the filter. The arrow should point away from the fuel pump, towards the pressure regulator.
Remove the fuel filter from the outlet hose.
Inspect all hoses for cracks, splits, fraying and other damage. Replace as necessary.
Check all hose clamps for cracks and signs of distortion. Replace as necessary.
Check the mesh filter for damage and replace the fuel pump if necessary.
Install the fuel filter to the outlet hose, ensuring the arrow on the filter points away from the pump. Secure the hose with the hose clip.
Check and ensure that the feet of the rubber isolator engage correctly in the fork.
Secure the fuel filter to the fuel pump bracket with two new cable ties.
Connect the fuel pump hose to the fuel filter and secure with the hose clip.
Refit the fuel pump securing bolt and strap and tighten the bolt to
Refit the hose bracket to the fuel pump bracket and tighten its fixing to
Carefully refit the baffle material into the front of the baffle housing.
Refit the baffle housing to the fuel pump as noted for removal.
Refit the fuel pump assembly D series

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DP4; DC4; D72; D92; DG4; DF4; DU3; DT3; DUY; DU; DEX; DF2; DF; DE; DE2; DD2; DBX; DB2; DB; DP3; DP2; DPA; DP

search: Fuel Filter - Renew
Removal
Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
A fire, causing personal injury and damage to property could result from spilled fuel or fuel not handled or stored correctly.
Remove the fuel pump assembly (see
Fuel Pump Assembly - Removal
Release the two fuel hose clips from either side of the fuel filter.
Remove the hose bracket from the fuel pump bracket.
Hose clips
Hose bracket
Carefully detach the baffle housing from the fuel pump.
Baffle housing
Hose clip
Remove the fuel pump securing bolt and strap.
Strap
Bolt
Disconnect the fuel pump hose from the fuel filter inlet.
Remove and discard the two fuel filter cable ties.
Cable ties
Prior to removing the filter, note the direction of the arrow on the side of the filter. The arrow should point away from the fuel pump, towards the pressure regulator.
Remove the fuel filter from the outlet hose.
Inspection
Inspect all hoses for cracks, splits, fraying and other damage. Replace as necessary.
Check all hose clamps for cracks and signs of distortion. Replace as necessary.
Check the mesh filter for damage and replace the fuel pump if necessary.
Installation
Install the fuel filter to the outlet hose, ensuring the arrow on the filter points away from the pump. Secure the hose with the hose clip.
Check and ensure that the feet of the rubber isolator engage correctly in the fork.
Fork
Isolator feet
Secure the fuel filter to the fuel pump bracket with two new cable ties.
Connect the fuel pump hose to the fuel filter and secure with the hose clip.
Refit the fuel pump securing bolt and strap and tighten the bolt to
4 Nm
Refit the hose bracket to the fuel pump bracket and tighten its fixing to
7 Nm
Carefully refit the baffle material into the front of the baffle housing.
Refit the baffle housing to the fuel pump as noted for removal.
Refit the fuel pump assembly (see
Fuel Pump Assembly - Installation
